column1: 28. The  learned  High  Court  Judge  has  observed  that  the  findings  of  the  learned
President  of  the  Labour  Tribunal  are  based  on  the  evidence  placed  before  the
Labour Tribunal and that “clear reasons are set out for these findings”. He has stated
that the obvious conclusions that could be arrived at is that these charges have not
been established. The learned Judge of the High Court has concluded by stating
that the “learned President has come to that correct conclusion”.
